# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(str)
        if length(word) > text_width
            error("Word '$word' is longer than the maximum text width of $text_width characters.")
        end
        push!(lines, word)
        if length(join(lines, "")) >= text_width
            # We have reached or exceeded the text width, so start a new line.
            push!(lines, "")
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at 10 characters per line.")
"Hello there\nthis is a very\nlong sentence\nthat should be\nwrapped at 10\ncharacters per line."
```
